children.subject:
I'm putting this as a followup so it doesn't get marked as resolved since you explicitly asked for an instructor answer. I asked Professor Sahai this very question at faculty advising this semester and he said 120/123 are more important for signal processing (along with 126/127); 118 doesn't hurt to add on but most likely there's more important classes to take than 118 so you should probably prioritize other stuff above 118.

Additionally, as someone who's taking 120 now and 123 next semester and has wondered this too, I've looked into 118 and it seems like more of the math perspective on Fourier Analysis (i.e. how sines and cosines are an uncountable basis for L2) and some added stuff on wavelets.

So, overall, I'd say take 120/123 for sure, add 118 if you have time. The consensus seems to be that 110 is the most important math upper div of all in general though. Others who know more can feel free to add on, just passing on what I've heard/seen.

history.content:
I'm interested in signal processing, and was wondering which of Math 118 and EE 120/123 would be better to take, and why?

It would be ideal if Prof Sahai could answer this as well.
history.subject: Math 118 vs EE 120/123
